title: Cascade Components North Fork brakes machine more power from SRAM Code Levers
content:
Cascade Componentâ€™s new North Fork brake caliper is machined in house in their Everett, Washington, factory to turn up the power coming from SRAM Code brake levers by 20%, while also reducing heat buildup. Known more for their linkage and rocker arm upgrade kits for bikes like the Ripmo and Reign, the Santa Cruz 5010,

The post Cascade Components North Fork brakes machine more power from SRAM Code Levers appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Tyler Benedict
